summary: Press release from the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program announcing the conclusion of its claims process. The program awarded approximately $125 million to about 150 eligible claimants, with 92% accepting offers. The program operated independently from the Epstein Estate and emphasized confidentiality and victim support.

persons.name: Jeff Solnet
persons.context: Listed as the press contact for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program press release.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator whose sexual abuse of victims led to the creation of the compensation program.

events.title: Launch of Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
events.description: The independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was launched to allow victims to resolve claims outside of court.

events.title: Program Announces Conclusion of Claims Process
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program announced it had concluded its claimant-facing operations, having awarded nearly $125 million.

keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program awarded nearly $125 million to approximately 150 eligible claimants.
92% of eligible claimants accepted their compensation offers from the program.
Approximately 225 claims were submitted, far exceeding the original expectation of 100 claims.
The program operated independently and free from any interference or control by the Epstein Estate.
Confidentiality was a cornerstone of the program, aimed at allowing reluctant victims to participate without public exposure.
